\"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/extensions/ERC721Enumerable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/extensions/ERC721URIStorage.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/token/ERC721/extensions/ERC721Burnable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts/access/AccessControl.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title GivvestCause\n * @dev Contract for managing fundraising causes using NFTs.\n */\ncontract GivvestCause is\n\tERC721,\n\tERC721Enumerable,\n\tERC721URIStorage,\n\tERC721Burnable,\n\tAccessControl\n{\n\tstruct Cause {\n\t\taddress fundraiser;\n\t\tuint256 amountNeeded;\n\t\tuint256 amountRaised;\n\t\tbool isActive;\n\t}\n\n\tbytes32 public constant MINTER_ROLE = keccak256(\"MINTER_ROLE\");\n\tbytes32 public constant GIVVEST_ROLE = keccak256(\"GIVVEST_ROLE\");\n\tuint256 public tokenCount;\n\n\t// Mapping from token ID to Cause details\n\tmapping(uint256 => Cause) public causes;\n\n\t// Events for logging important actions\n\tevent CauseMinted(\n\t\tuint256 tokenId,\n\t\taddress fundraiser,\n\t\tuint256 amountNeeded\n\t);\n\tevent AmountRaised(uint256 tokenId, uint256 amount);\n\tevent CauseStateToggled(uint256 tokenId, bool isActive);\n\tevent OwnershipChanged(address newOwner);\n\n\t/**\n\t * @dev Initializes the contract, setting up roles.\n\t * @param initialOwner The address of the initial owner.\n\t */\n\tconstructor(address initialOwner) ERC721(\"GivvestCause\", \"GCOS\") {\n\t\t_grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, initialOwner);\n\t\t_grantRole(MINTER_ROLE, initialOwner);\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @notice Safely mint a new token with cause details.\n\t * @param uri The URI of the token metadata.\n\t * @param fundraiser The address of the fundraiser.\n\t * @param amountNeeded The amount needed for the cause.\n\t */\n\tfunction safeMint(\n\t\tstring memory uri,\n\t\taddress fundraiser,\n\t\tuint256 amountNeeded\n\t) public onlyRole(MINTER_ROLE) {\n\t\trequire(amountNeeded > 0, \"Amount needed must be greater than zero\");\n\t\trequire(fundraiser != address(0), \"Invalid fundraiser address\");\n\t\t//assigns tokenCount to tokenId before incrementing\n\t\tuint256 tokenId = tokenCount++;\n\t\t_safeMint(msg.sender, tokenId);\n\t\t_setTokenURI(tokenId, uri);\n\n\t\tcauses[tokenId] = Cause({\n\t\t\tfundraiser: fundraiser,\n\t\t\tamountNeeded: amountNeeded,\n\t\t\tamountRaised: 0,\n\t\t\tisActive: true\n\t\t});\n\n\t\temit CauseMinted(tokenId, fundraiser, amountNeeded);\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @notice Raise an amount for a specific cause.\n\t * @param tokenId The ID of the cause token.\n\t * @param amount The amount to raise.\n\t */\n\tfunction raiseAmount(\n\t\tuint256 tokenId,\n\t\tuint256 amount\n\t) public onlyRole(GIVVEST_ROLE) {\n\t\tCause storage cause = causes[tokenId];\n\t\trequire(cause.isActive, \"Cause is not actively fundraising\");\n\t\trequire(\n\t\t\tcause.amountRaised + amount <= cause.amountNeeded,\n\t\t\t\"Amount is more than needed\"\n\t\t);\n\t\tcause.amountRaised += amount;\n\t\tif (cause.amountRaised == cause.amountNeeded) {\n\t\t\tcause.isActive = false;\n\t\t}\n\n\t\temit AmountRaised(tokenId, amount);\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @notice Toggle the active state of a cause.\n\t * @param tokenId The ID of the cause token.\n\t */\n\tfunction toggleCauseState(uint256 tokenId) public {\n\t\tCause storage cause = causes[tokenId];\n\t\trequire(\n\t\t\tcause.isActive || cause.amountRaised < cause.amountNeeded,\n\t\t\t\"Fundraising is already complete\"\n\t\t);\n\t\trequire(\n\t\t\tcause.fundraiser == msg.sender ||\n\t\t\t\thasRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender),\n\t\t\t\"Not permitted\"\n\t\t);\n\t\tcause.isActive = !cause.isActive;\n\n\t\temit CauseStateToggled(tokenId, cause.isActive);\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @notice Get the address of the fundraiser for a specific cause.\n\t * @param tokenId The ID of the cause token.\n\t * @return The address of the fundraiser.\n\t */\n\tfunction getFundraiser(uint256 tokenId) public view returns (address) {\n\t\treturn causes[tokenId].fundraiser;\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @notice Grant the minter role to an address.\n\t * @param minter The address to be granted the minter role.\n\t */\n\tfunction grantMinterRole(\n\t\taddress minter\n\t) public onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n\t\t_grantRole(MINTER_ROLE, minter);\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @notice Grant the Givvest role to a contract address.\n\t * @param givvestContract The contract address to be granted the GIVVEST_ROLE.\n\t */\n\tfunction grantGivvestRole(\n\t\taddress givvestContract\n\t) public onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n\t\t_grantRole(GIVVEST_ROLE, givvestContract);\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @notice Change the ownership of the contract to a new address.\n\t * @param to The address of the new owner.\n\t */\n\tfunction changeOwnership(address to) public onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n\t\t_grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, to);\n\t\t_revokeRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender);\n\n\t\temit OwnershipChanged(to);\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @dev Override for `_update` function to ensure compatibility with multiple inheritance.\n\t */\n\tfunction _update(\n\t\taddress to,\n\t\tuint256 tokenId,\n\t\taddress auth\n\t) internal override(ERC721, ERC721Enumerable) returns (address) {\n\t\treturn super._update(to, tokenId, auth);\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @dev Override for `_increaseBalance` function to ensure compatibility with multiple inheritance.\n\t */\n\tfunction _increaseBalance(\n\t\taddress account,\n\t\tuint128 value\n\t) internal override(ERC721, ERC721Enumerable) {\n\t\tsuper._increaseBalance(account, value);\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @notice Get the token URI for a specific token ID.\n\t * @param tokenId The ID of the token.\n\t * @return The token URI.\n\t */\n\tfunction tokenURI(\n\t\tuint256 tokenId\n\t) public view override(ERC721, ERC721URIStorage) returns (string memory) {\n\t\treturn super.tokenURI(tokenId);\n\t}\n\n\t/**\n\t * @dev Override for `supportsInterface` function to ensure compatibility with multiple inheritance.\n\t */\n\tfunction supportsInterface(\n\t\tbytes4 interfaceId\n\t)\n\t\tpublic\n\t\tview\n\t\toverride(ERC721, ERC721Enumerable, ERC721URIStorage, AccessControl)\n\t\treturns (bool)\n\t{\n\t\treturn super.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\n\t}\n}\n","keccak256":"0x27c8e481dc96ac71c1330be128e73caa0cbe7a184b84784983013328bf6d12ac","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

devdoc.details: Contract for managing fundraising causes using NFTs.

AccessControlBadConfirmation().details: The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}.

ERC721IncorrectOwner(address,uint256,add.details: Indicates an error related to the ownership over a particular token. Used in transfers.

params.owner: Address of the current owner of a token.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC721InsufficientApproval(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `operator`s approval. Used in transfers.

params.operator: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC721InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC721InvalidOperator(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `operator` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.operator: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC721InvalidOwner(address).details: Indicates that an address can't be an owner. For example, `address(0)` is a forbidden owner in ERC-20. Used in balance queries.

params.owner: Address of the current owner of a token.

ERC721InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC721InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC721NonexistentToken(uint256).details: Indicates a `tokenId` whose `owner` is the zero address.

ERC721OutOfBoundsIndex(address,uint256).details: An `owner`'s token query was out of bounds for `index`. NOTE: The owner being `address(0)` indicates a global out of bounds index.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `owner` enables `approved` to manage the `tokenId` token.

ApprovalForAll(address,address,bool).details: Emitted when `owner` enables or disables (`approved`) `operator` to manage all of its assets.

BatchMetadataUpdate(uint256,uint256).details: This event emits when the metadata of a range of tokens is changed. So that the third-party platforms such as NFT market could timely update the images and related attributes of the NFTs.

MetadataUpdate(uint256).details: This event emits when the metadata of a token is changed. So that the third-party platforms such as NFT market could timely update the images and related attributes of the NFT.

RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32.details: Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted signaling this.

RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}.

RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address).details: Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `tokenId` token is transferred from `from` to `to`.

burn(uint256).details: Burns `tokenId`. See {ERC721-_burn}. Requirements: - The caller must own `tokenId` or be an approved operator.

params.to: The address of the new owner.

constructor.details: Initializes the contract, setting up roles.

params.initialOwner: The address of the initial owner.

params.tokenId: The ID of the cause token.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

params.givvestContract: The contract address to be granted the GIVVEST_ROLE.

params.minter: The address to be granted the minter role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.tokenId: The ID of the cause token.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

params.amountNeeded: The amount needed for the cause.
params.uri: The URI of the token metadata.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: Override for `supportsInterface` function to ensure compatibility with multiple inheritance.

params.tokenId: The ID of the cause token.
